Creating a sublimit
The business process of working with limits often involves creating a sublimit outside of its registry. To place the Create sublimit button outside of the main instance registry, use the
Create sublimit
action.
To configure the
Create sublimit
action, you need to:
Go to the action registry (
Learn more about working with the registry
). Select the
Create sublimit
action. The System will display a profile to configure a custom action.
2. Add the required settings to the
Actions
profile. The general action settings are given
here
. No additional action settings are required.
3. Select the object type to configure the action for. Here you can override the action name (if needed).
4. Save your settings.
The object registry will display the button configured to add a sublimit.
When adding a sublimit via a button:
A dialog box with a limit structure of all types is displayed automatically (similar to creating a sublimit from a limit profile)
When creating a sublimit, the entire hierarchy of the limit is automatically formed up to the parent limit (similar to creating a limit from a profile)
When creating a sublimit for a previously created child limit, the corresponding sublimit structure hierarchy is automatically displayed it means, if you select a line in the limits registry and add a sublimit, the dialog box displays the corresponding hierarchy of the sublimit structure (like in the limit profile, when you see only the structure that is configured for the selected limit profile).
